chain.description: I flipped a coin and it landed on Tails. As for the asset with the UUID 'f1ff77b6-3ab4-4719-9ded-2fc7e71cff1f', it corresponds to Bitcoin (BTC). Bitcoin is an active cryptocurrency. You can find more information about it on the [Bitcoin official website](https://bitcoin.org).

compare_candidates.description: I flipped a coin and it landed on Tails. As for the asset with the UUID 'f1ff77b6-3ab4-4719-9ded-2fc7e71cff1f', it corresponds to Bitcoin (BTC). Bitcoin is an active cryptocurrency. You can find more information about it on the [Bitcoin official website](https://bitcoin.org).

function.name: coinmill_for_coinmill_currency
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "coinmill_currency", you can use this tool.

function.name: assetbyid_for_bravenewcoin
function.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "bravenewcoin", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Retrieves the details of an individual asset. Supply the unique identifier (UUID) of the asset.

The full list of all asset details can be obtained from the Asset endpoint."

is_id.description: The unique resource identifier (UUID) of an asset e.g.  BTC = f1ff77b6-3ab4-4719-9ded-2fc7e71cff1f

function.name: asset_for_bravenewcoin
function.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "bravenewcoin", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "List the UUID and details for all assets or provide an optional query parameter to search.
asset_for_bravenewcoins may have a status . Active assets will be available at both asset_for_bravenewcoinTicker and DailyOHLCV endpoints. Inactive assets are not av"

function.name: market_for_bravenewcoin
function.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "bravenewcoin", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "List the UUIDs for all markets or provide a query parameter to search.

The parameters are asset UUIDs. The full list of all asset details is available from the Asset endpoint."

function.name: heads_tails_for_coin_flip
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "coin_flip", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Returns an outcome. Either heads or tails"

function.name: get_coin_modifiers_for_coinranking
function.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "coinranking", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get the modifiers of a coin's supply and their balance.
This endpoint requires the **ultra** plan or higher."

uuid.description: UUID of the coin you want to request the modifiers for

offset.description:
Offset. Used for pagination

Default value: 0

limit.description:
Limit. Used for pagination

Default value: 50
Size range: 0-100

function.name: get_coin_price_history_for_coinranking
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "coinranking", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Coinranking keeps track of prices on all listed assets. The history endpoint lists prices and their timestamp for the requested time period, useful for making a chart."

uuid.description: UUID of the coin you want to request

referencecurrencyuuid.description:
UUID of reference currency, in which all the prices are calculated. Defaults to US Dollar

Default value: yhjMzLPhuIDl

timeperiod.description:
Timeperiod where the change and history are based on

Default value: 24h
Allowed values:
3h 24h 7d 30d 3m 1y 3y 5y

function.name: get_coin_price_for_coinranking
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "coinranking", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "With the price endpoint the price can be requested for a specific coin on a specific time. The response is just a single price nearest to the requested time, including its timestamp."

uuid.description: UUID of the coin you need the price

timestamp.description: Timestamp. Epoch timestamp in seconds. If it is not provided this endpoint will get the latest price

referencecurrencyuuid.description:
UUID of reference currency. This is the currency the price is shown in, which defaults to US Dollar

Default value: yhjMzLPhuIDl

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"

train_messages.content:
You are AutoGPT, you can use many tools(functions) to do the following task.
First I will give you the task description, and your task start.
At each step, you need to give your thought to analyze the status now and what to do next, with a function call to actually excute your step.
After the call, you will get the call result, and you are now in a new state.
Then you will analyze your status now, then decide what to do next...
After many (Thought-call) pairs, you finally perform the task, then you can give your finial answer.
Remember: 
1.the state change is irreversible, you can't go back to one of the former state, if you want to restart the task, say "I give up and restart".
2.All the thought is short, at most in 5 sentence.
3.You can do more then one trys, so if your plan is to continusly try some conditions, you can do one of the conditions per try.
Let's Begin!
Task description: You should use functions to help handle the real time user querys. Remember:
1.ALWAYS call "Finish" function at the end of the task. And the final answer should contain enough information to show to the user,If you can't handle the task, or you find that function calls always fail(the function is not valid now), use function Finish->give_up_and_restart.
2.Do not use origin tool names, use only subfunctions' names.
You have access of the following tools:
1.coinmill_currency: JavaScript API for powering currency exchange rates on websites.
2.bravenewcoin: Latest and historic cryptocurrency market data
3.coin_flip: API that flips a coin
4.coinranking: A simple API for Cryptocurrency Prices - 28k+ users - Real-Time & Historical - Crypto Market Data - Coins - Exchanges - Free & Paid
